dmca.title: New Zealand Herald objects to copied premium content
dmca.body:
To whom it may concern, 

This letter is to report a violation of clause 4 of your blogspot.com TOC (MEMBER CONDUCT) by one of your bloggers having setup a site at: 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/ 

On October 18, 2005, the New Zealand Herald (nzherald.co.nz) launched a subscription service that wrapped a pay model around certain types of content This content is limited to the writings from certain journalists. 

This content is now appearing on your site under the URL mentioned above. This content is the property of the NZH and this user is in breach of sub-item (d) of the MEMBER CONDUCT clause. We would like the site removed and, if possible, be given the information on the person holding the account. 

Below are the points that you require to lodge the complaint as per your email dated November 11, 2O05 

1. Identify in sufficient detail the copyrighted work that you believe as been infringed upon. 

Although some specific posts are included here, the entire site is in breach. There are NO posts on this site that represents the owners views or thoughts. All material on the site is copyrighted by the New Zealand Herald. 

Specific posts 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005/11/editorial-no-way-to-treat-scientist.html 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005/11/mike-oliver-airline-jumps-at-shadows.html 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005/11/william-mccook-increased-farmer-levies.html 

Archive posts 

http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005_11_07_heraldpremiumcontent_arch 
ive.html 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005_11_08_heraldpremiumcontent_archive.html 
http://heraldpremiumcontent.blogspot.com/2005_11_09_heraldpremiumcontent_archive.html 

2. Identify the material that you claim is infringing upon the copyrighted work listed In Item #1 above. 

The posts listed above are, in their entirety, made up of copyrighted work and 
represent newspaper stories that are in the subscription area of the New Zealand 
Herald website. In addition to the posts listed above, ALL POSTS on the site are 
NZH stories and are in violation of copyright.

3. Provide Information reasonably sufficient to permit Blogger to contact you (email address is preferred). 

[Private]
Group, Internet Manager 
APN Holdings NZ Ltd 
[Private]
Auckland 1001 
New Zealand 
Phone: +64 [private]
Mobile: +64 [private] 
Email: [private]@apn.co.nz 

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its 
agent, or the law. 

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. 

Thank you for your help in the very important matter, 

[Private]
